questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following characterizes the post 1991 - investment climate in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Low response of the private sector to investment policy
questionList.choiceB: Conducive environment for private investment

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is NOT the role and responsibility of the National Bank of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceB: To regulate interest rate

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the short run production function?
questionList.choiceA: Economies of scale is in operation
questionList.choiceB: It is a period when all factors of production are fixed
questionList.choiceC: The law of diminishing marginal returns is in operation
questionList.choiceD: It is a period when all factors of production are varying

questionList.questionStatement: The economic cost of unemployment is:
questionList.choiceB: Amount of the output that is foregone
questionList.choiceC: Cost associated with stress and illness of the unemployed
questionList.choiceD: Socio political unrest of the unemployed labor force

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following in NOT true about the relationship between production (Q), Average Product (AP), Marginal Cost (MC) and Average Cost (AC) and Marginal Product (MP)?
questionList.choiceB: If MC > AC, then AC is increased by increasing Q

questionList.questionStatement: If the consumption function of a given individual is given as C = 26 / O.75Yd Birr, where C represents Consumption per period and Yd represents the individual's disposable income per period. If the. individual's disposable income for a specific period was 1000 Birr, what was the saving of the individual during the same period?
questionList.choiceB: 250 Birr

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following factors did NOT contribute to a better performance of the industrial sector during the post reform period?
questionList.choiceB: Recovery of the agricultural sector and increased supply of raw materials
questionList.choiceD: Imposition of capital ceilings on private sector investment capital up to 500,000 Birr

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the dominant sub-sector in the Ethiopian Agricultural sector?
questionList.choiceB: Animal husbandry

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following behavioral assumptions is true about basic decision-making units in economics?
questionList.choiceB: Firms are utility maximizers.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the conditions during a period of price rise?
questionList.choiceA: Both nominal and real GDP decline at the same rate
questionList.choiceB: Real GDP increases slower than nominal GDP
questionList.choiceC: Real GDP increases faster than nominal GDP
questionList.choiceD: Nominal and real GDP increase at the same rate

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is always correct about heavy democratic borrowing by government?
questionList.choiceB: It result is an increase of real interest rate
questionList.choiceC: It results in a decrease of real interest rate

questionList.questionStatement: The three economic problems of what, how and for whom commodities should be produced apply to which one of the following?
questionList.choiceA: Only to free enterprises or capitalist societies, wherein the problems of choice is most acute.
questionList.choiceB: Mainly to totalitarian or centrally planned societies, wherein the problem of planning arises directly
questionList.choiceC: Only to the less development societies, since development is largely a question of meeting these three problems.
questionList.choiceD: To all societies, regardless of stage of development or form of political organization.

questionList.questionStatement: All of the following are in the broad definition o money in the Ethiopian context except:
questionList.choiceA: Currency in the hands of the public
questionList.choiceB: Bonds are Treasury bills
questionList.choiceC: Currency in circulation outside the banks

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following refers to the study by microeconomics?
questionList.choiceB: The cause of inflation
questionList.choiceC: The economic behavior of small economic units
questionList.choiceD: The aggregate level of the economy

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following description in correct about the balance of payment position of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Service account with negative balance of payments
questionList.choiceB: Positive balance of payment during the derg period
questionList.choiceD: Chronic trade deficit as the dominant feature

questionList.questionStatement: A pure monopolist faces demand function of P = 20 - Q units and her cost function is given by TC = 2 / 4Q2 units. What are the profit maximizing level of output and the corresponding profits, respectively?
questionList.choiceB: 18 and 2

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is NOT a reform measure undertaken by the government in 1991 to overcome fiscal imbalance?
questionList.choiceB: High degree of centralization in decision makings

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about choice in economics?
questionList.choiceB: It arises as a result of shortage
questionList.choiceC: It arises as a result of existence of free resource
questionList.choiceD: It arises as result of unlimited output

questionList.questionStatement: There would be double counting in GDP computations if statisticians were to add together.
questionList.choiceA: Net value added by the iron mining industry and net value added by the steel industry
questionList.choiceB: Net increase in inventories of flourmills and net increase in inventories of bakeries
questionList.choiceC: Total output of iron ore and total output of steel industry.
questionList.choiceD: Value added by bakers and value of the baker's salespeople's services

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following measures need to be undertaken to address the problem of land fragmentation effectively?
questionList.choiceA: Enhancing formation of peasant associations and cooperatives on a large scale.
questionList.choiceB: Arresting the rate of growth of the population
questionList.choiceC: Expansion of farming land by eradicating forest and grazing area
questionList.choiceD: Adoption and promotion of conservation based farming practices

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the alternatives contains the three important industrial groups that contribute significantly to the total gross value of output of manufacturing firms?
questionList.choiceB: Food & beverage, textiles and metals
questionList.choiceC: Food & beverage, metals and non metals
questionList.choiceD: Leather & foot wear, food & beverage and metals

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT related to the simplest model of circular flow of income?
questionList.choiceB: Foreign exchange earnings.
questionList.choiceC: Factors of factors of production and wages.
questionList.choiceD: Supply of goods and consumer expenditure

questionList.questionStatement: An increase in the price of a substitute good results in which of the following changes in the commodity's equilibrium price and quantity?
questionList.choiceB: Price rises and quantity falls

questionList.questionStatement: The new economic policy reform was needed in the:
questionList.choiceA: Poor economic performance of the country
questionList.choiceB: Equitable distribution of income

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true with respect to open market operations (DMO) in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Open market operations are indirect monetary policy
questionList.choiceB: Open market operations were introduced by the new government 1994/95.
questionList.choiceC: Open market operations work by controlling the money supply in an economy.
questionList.choiceD: Open market operations are tools of fiscal policy

questionList.questionStatement: Fiscal Decentralization and public sector Reform in Ethiopia since 1992/93 includes all of the following except one. Which one
questionList.choiceB: Increasing the difference between the maximum and minimum ad-avorem tax rate
questionList.choiceD: Reduction of the marginal tax rate

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about the supply function given by Qs = -1 + 0.25P, where Qs is the quantity supplied and P is the price?
questionList.choiceA: If there are 10 identical supply functions in the market, the market supply is P = 400 + 40Qs.
questionList.choiceB: The Equilibrium quantity supplied Qs and price are 40 &20
questionList.choiceC: When price is zero quantity supplied is 22
questionList.choiceD: When Qs is zero Price is 20

questionList.questionStatement: As a result of an equal rise of productivity for all sectors in an economy, its production possibility frontier (PPF) will.
questionList.choiceB: Not be affected
questionList.choiceC: Be affected whereby the old PPF will be inside the new PPF
questionList.choiceD: Be affected whereby the new-PPF will be inside the old PPF

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following changes is true about the determinants of demand? Change in: -
questionList.choiceA: Income of the consumer causes a movement along the demand curve
questionList.choiceB: Own price of a commodity causes a shift of the demand curve
questionList.choiceC: In the number of buyers in the market reduces the demand for that commodity
questionList.choiceD: Own price of a commodity causes a movement along the demand curve

questionList.questionStatement: The status of the public finance during the military government (1974 - 1991) in Ethiopia was directed towards the:
questionList.choiceB: Improvement of agricultural productivity

questionList.questionStatement: Suppose the market demand function for X is given by Qx = 20 - 2P and the market supply function of X is Qx = -4 + P. what are the market clearing quantity and price respectively?
questionList.choiceB: Q=12 and P=8

questionList.questionStatement: Tariff on imports does NOT result in which of the following?
questionList.choiceA: Benefit consumer that import the goods
questionList.choiceB: Increase the price of the imported goods
questionList.choiceC: Increase government revenue in the form of custom duties

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following will cause a rightward shift of the supply curves of grains?
questionList.choiceB: An increase in the cost of inputs

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following government policies has disadvantaged the process of industrialization in Ethiopia during the past 50 years?
questionList.choiceA: Generous tax incentive during the imperial period
questionList.choiceB: Easy access to domestic credit in favorable terms during the imperial period
questionList.choiceC: Nationalization of the medium and large-scale enterprises during the military government
questionList.choiceD: High levels of tariff protection during the imperial period

questionList.questionStatement: If a country following a policy of fixed exchange rate suffers from a persistent balance of payment deficit, then the country can improve its balance of payment by:
questionList.choiceB: Floating its currency

questionList.questionStatement: The total population in Ethiopia in the year 2005 was 73,044,000. Out of this population,45% was below the age of 15 and 3% was above the age of 65. What was the dependency Ratio in the year 2005?
A country imposes tariffs to protect:
questionList.choiceB: Domestic producers from foreign competition

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following does NOT explain why more than 50% of the Ethiopian population remained in absolute poverty or food insecure?
questionList.choiceB: Excess supply of non-fertilizer credit over demand

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statements properly qualify the role of international trade in economic development?
questionList.choiceA: It enables a country to consume and produce more than would be possible without trade
questionList.choiceB: It brings goods and services that can be produced within the domestic economy
questionList.choiceC: It enables labor to move from one country to another

questionList.questionStatement: What is the opportunity cost of 1 percentage point mark of mathematics?
questionList.choiceB: 2 percentage point marks of economics
